info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 3:28PM EST until January 11 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... South Fork Catawba River At Lowell affecting Gaston County. .A potent storm system is expected to produce 3-4 inches of rainfall across the South Fork Catawba watershed from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. This rainfall will quickly overwhelm saturated soils and result in excessive runoff and significant stream rises across southeastern Burke County, Catawba County, Lincoln County, and Gaston County, with several small tributaries of the SF Catawba River possibly exceeding bankfull and causing nuisance to Minor flooding of adjacent areas as early as late Tuesday morning. This excessive flow will cause the South Fork Catawba River near Lowell, McAdenville, and Cramerton to exceed Minor Flood Stage early Tuesday afternoon and possibly Moderate Flood Stage overnight Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. This will result in common, deeper flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to the South Fork Catawba River with lesser impacts to vulnerable property. More significant inundation with floodwaters approaching vulnerable buildings and property near Cramerton is possible if the river exceeds Moderate Flood Stage. Residents and business owners are advised to move vulnerable property to higher ground and stay up-to-date by monitoring the latest river levels and forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. Moderate flooding is possible. * WHERE...South Fork Catawba River at Lowell. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Minor Flooding continues. The South Fork Catawba River is likely inundating Riverside Dr. between 5th and 6th Streets in Cramerton with several inches of water. The pumping station at Pharr Yarns in McAdenville may begin to flood. At 12.0 feet, Minor Flooding continues. South Fork Catawba River floodwaters may approach the Cramerton Fire Department building at the intersection 8th Ave and 9th St. The parking lot behind the adjacent Cramerton Drug Company may be flooded. Floodwaters may approach one home along Riverside Dr. in Cramerton. At 13.0 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. The South Fork Catawba River may be approaching the crawl spaces of homes along Riverside Dr. between 4th St. and 5th St. in Cramerton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 3.5 feet and nearly steady. - Action/Advisory Stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above Minor Flood Stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 12.3 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below Minor Flood Stage late Wednesday evening. A crest above the Moderate Flood Stage of 13.0 feet is possible Wednesday morning. Please closely monitor the latest levels and forecasts. - Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued beforeThursday morning at 1100 AM EST.
